system_prompt: You are a precise research analyst. Respond with strictly valid JSON matching the provided schema. Do not include explanations or markdown.
user_prompt:
Validate and enrich the museum record using only the evidence provided.

CRITICAL: Extract ALL available fields from the evidence. Do not leave fields empty if evidence exists.

REQUIRED FIELDS TO EXTRACT (if evidence exists):
1. IDENTITY & LOCATION:
   - museum_name: Official name from website/Wikipedia
   - city: City name (verify from address, website, or nominatim)
   - street_address: Full street address from 'Contact', 'Visit', 'Location', 'Hours', 'About' pages
   - postal_code: ZIP/postal code from address
   - website: Validated URL (ensure it's active)
   - latitude, longitude: Coordinates from nominatim or website

2. CLASSIFICATION:
   - primary_domain: Art|History|Science|Culture|Specialty|Mixed (analyze collection focus)
   - museum_type: Specific category (e.g., 'Art Museum', 'History Museum', 'Children\'s Museum')
   - audience_focus: Target audience (e.g., 'General', 'Families', 'Scholars')

3. QUALITY INDICATORS:
   - city_tier: 1-5 (1=major metro, 5=small town) based on city population/prominence
   - reputation: 1-5 (1=world-renowned, 5=local) based on Wikipedia presence, awards, size
   - collection_tier: 1-5 (1=world-class, 5=modest) based on collection description
   - time_needed: '1-2 hours'|'Half day'|'Full day'|'Multiple days' (estimate from collection size)

4. ART SCORING (ONLY if primary_domain is Art):
   - impressionist_strength: 1-5 (strength of impressionist collection)
   - modern_contemporary_strength: 1-5 (strength of modern/contemporary collection)
   - historical_context_score: 1-5 (historical significance of the institution)

5. SUMMARY:
   - notes: 2-3 sentence summary covering: type of museum, notable collections, unique features

EXTRACTION RULES:
- Confidence scale: 1-5 ONLY (1=very uncertain, 5=highly certain from official source)
- Trust levels: Use OFFICIAL_EXTRACT (5) for website data, WIKIPEDIA (3) for Wikipedia, LLM_EXTRACTED (2) for inference
- Sources: Be specific ('official_website/visit', 'wikipedia', 'nominatim', 'wikidata')
- Do not guess - only extract what you can verify from evidence
- CRITICAL: If a field has no evidence, OMIT it entirely from state_file_updates (set to null, not an object with null values)
- Check ALL evidence sources: website_text, website_json_ld, wikipedia, wikidata, nominatim

Evidence Packet:
{
  "identity": {
    "museum_id": "usa-al-birmingham-abroms-engel-institute-for-visual-arts",
    "museum_name": "Abroms-Engel Institute for Visual Arts",
    "city": "Birmingham",
    "state_province": "Alabama",
    "country": "USA",
    "website": "http://www.uab.edu/cas/aeiva",
    "primary_domain": "Art"
  },
  "state_record_subset": {
    "museum_type": null,
    "audience_focus": null,
    "city_tier": 2,
    "reputation": null,
    "collection_tier": null,
    "time_needed": "Half day",
    "notes": "Designed by the world-renowned architect, the late Randall Stout, AEIVA is a center for UAB and the Birmingham community to engage with contemporary art and art\n\nEmail: AEIVA@uab.edu"
  },
  "wikidata_claims": {},
  "wikipedia_summary": null,
  "website_json_ld": {},
  "website_text_snippet": "[](/aeiva/events \"Upcoming Events\")\n## [Upcoming Events](/aeiva/events)\n[View More Events](/aeiva/events)\n[](/aeiva/exhibitions \"Exhibitions\")\n## [Exhibitions](/aeiva/exhibitions)\nAEIVA presents seven to ten contemporary art exhibitions each year, including solo and thematic group exhibitions, exhibitions from AEIVA's permanent collection, and an annual graduating BFA exhibition. \n[](/aeiva/visit \"Visit AEIVA\")\n## [Visit AEIVA](/aeiva/visit)\nAEIVA is open to the public Tuesday through Saturday, 12 pm to 5 pm, and closed on Sundays and Mondays. \n[](/aeiva/facility-rental \"Facility Rental\")\n## [Facility Rental](/aeiva/facility-rental)\nAEIVA houses the Department of Art and Art History, three galleries, a lecture hall that holds up to 64 seats, and an atrium that can accommodate up to 100 individuals. \n[](https://www.alysstephens.org/support/membership/ \"Become a Member\")\n## [Become a Member](https://www.alysstephens.org/support/membership/)\nBecome part of the AEIVA community and help support cutting-edge exhibitions, a growing permanent collection, dynamic lectures and other educational programs.\n[](/aeiva/about \"About Us\")\n## [About Us](/aeiva/about)\nDesigned by world-renowned ar...",
  "subpages_scraped": [],
  "packet_metadata": {
    "approx_tokens": 518,
    "max_chars": 8000
  }
}

Return JSON matching the ValidationAgentOutput schema with as many fields populated as evidence supports.

state_record_subset.notes:
Designed by the world-renowned architect, the late Randall Stout, AEIVA is a center for UAB and the Birmingham community to engage with contemporary art and art

Email: AEIVA@uab.edu

evidence_packet.website_text_snippet:
[](/aeiva/events "Upcoming Events")
## [Upcoming Events](/aeiva/events)
[View More Events](/aeiva/events)
[](/aeiva/exhibitions "Exhibitions")
## [Exhibitions](/aeiva/exhibitions)
AEIVA presents seven to ten contemporary art exhibitions each year, including solo and thematic group exhibitions, exhibitions from AEIVA's permanent collection, and an annual graduating BFA exhibition. 
[](/aeiva/visit "Visit AEIVA")
## [Visit AEIVA](/aeiva/visit)
AEIVA is open to the public Tuesday through Saturday, 12 pm to 5 pm, and closed on Sundays and Mondays. 
[](/aeiva/facility-rental "Facility Rental")
## [Facility Rental](/aeiva/facility-rental)
AEIVA houses the Department of Art and Art History, three galleries, a lecture hall that holds up to 64 seats, and an atrium that can accommodate up to 100 individuals. 
[](https://www.alysstephens.org/support/membership/ "Become a Member")
## [Become a Member](https://www.alysstephens.org/support/membership/)
Become part of the AEIVA community and help support cutting-edge exhibitions, a growing permanent collection, dynamic lectures and other educational programs.
[](/aeiva/about "About Us")
## [About Us](/aeiva/about)
